trial_identification.studytitle: Combination of furosemide and albumin for treatment of edema in chronic kidney disease patients
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Combination of furosemide and albumin for treatment of edema in chronic kidney disease patients

interventions.interventions: crossover study treatment with furosemide 40 mg plus albumin 10 gm intravenously one time or with furosamide 40 mg intravenously alone one time and then 2 week washout period before moving onto the alternate treatment.
interventions.comparator: treatment with furosemide 40 mg intravenously alone one time

primaryOutcome.outcome: Volume of urine output (mL) compare the average increment of urine out put at 6 hour and at 24 hour between 2 interventions by using pair t test
Urine sodium (mEq) compare the average increment of urine sodium at 6 hour and at 24 hour between 2 interventions by using pair t test

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Stable CKD patients were defined as patients who have GFR < 60 mL/min per 1.73m2 and no fluctuation of GFR > 10% with in 2 months
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Patients with GFR < 10 mL/min per 1.73m2, critically ill patients such as congestive heart failure, acute renal failure, shock, on respirator and previous history of furosemide usage within two week

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Ramathibodi Hospital Rama 4 Road Bangkok Thailand

fundingsource.fundingaddress: Ramathibodi Hospital Rama 4 Road Bangkok Thailand

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Comparison the efficacy of diuretic between furosemide and furosemide plus albumin in stable CKD patients by measuring urine output and urine sodium.

ethicscommitee.ethicname: Committe on Human Rights Related to Researchs Involving Human Subjects, Ramathibodi hospital
ethicscommitee.ethicaddress: Ramathibodi Hospital Rama 4 Road Bangkok Thailand
